issue.title: Adding code points and OIDs for Dilithium.

comment.body:
> The sed wasn't as bad as I thought. 

Good to hear that and sorry I currently don't have the bandwidth to set this up myself -- just too many elements involved costing too much time to confirm correct operation :-(

> External 3rd party confirmed the fix.

Which confirmation are you referring to? I only found [this](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/issues/164#issuecomment-1330749077) -- and it doesn't look OK. Also, does this confirmation refer to the "wolfssl" flavour or the "OQS" flavour -- which is the default here? I'm still surprised seeing the define `OQS_KEM` used to carry signature names: That does not look right: KEMs and SIGs are clearly separated [in the OQS master file here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/blob/OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable/qsc.h). I do understand that this approach can work for signatures in the "manipulated" `wolfssl-qsc.h" file but not for the "OQS" version: Hence the question: What confirmation (using which setup) has been given?

issue.title: [WIP] Sync with upstream
issue.body:
ðŸš¨ WIP - DO NOT MERGE ðŸš¨

---

Update to commit [f0518d](https://github.com/google/boringssl/commit/f0518d45119dd4dd322a884669daf8247bc3c992).

**Note:** Some tests still fail, see output of `ninja run_tests` below.

Compiled on Windows x64, Apple silicon (ARM), macOS 13.0.

FYI, compilation for x86 works the same, to do so on an M1/M2 Mac - add to `CMakeLists.txt` (both to BSSL and `liboqs`):

```
SET(CMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES "x86_64" CACHE INTERNAL "" FORCE)
SET(CMAKE_OSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET "10.13.0" CACHE INTERNAL "" FORCE)
```

comment.body:
> Looks great. I've made a comment related to your `TODO(guywald)` comments. I don't think we need to add the `.DS_Store` and `.vscode/settings.json` files; can you remove them?

Yes, thanks that is addressed and resolved.
Removed the redundant files and updated `.gitignore`, intending on doing a round of polish later today (was mostly for PoC purposes at first and to see that tests pass).

comment.body:
@christianpaquin 
> Looks great. I've made a comment related to your `TODO(guywald)` comments. I don't think we need to add the `.DS_Store` and `.vscode/settings.json` files; can you remove them?

Yes, thanks that is addressed and resolved.
Removed the redundant files and updated `.gitignore`. PR def needs more attention on my end (initial draft PR mostly for PoC purposes and to see that tests pass), intending on doing a round of polish later today.

issue.title: Wireshark docker image does not recognize PQC algorithm: Display as Unknown
issue.body:
I have downloaded the Docker Wireshark image as noted on the code page and ran it as per the instructions
I can see the Wireshark version as Version 3.4.9 (Git commit 365e236f5efe) 

I captured the Wireshark traffic but still, it does not recognize the post-quantum crypto algorithm in the handshake process.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/115164852/200841197-f8289e97-483e-4419-b6dc-ce7db669caaa.png)

comment.body: @Jpgig , you expressed that you found success over a private channel.  Can you do so publicly here as well?  Also, please close the issue if you feel it has been resolved.

issue.title: Wireshark docker image does not recognize PQC algorithm: Display as Unknown
issue.body:
I have downloaded the Docker Wireshark image as noted on the code page and ran it as per the instructions
I can see the Wireshark version as Version 3.4.9 (Git commit 365e236f5efe) 

I captured the Wireshark traffic but still, it does not recognize the post-quantum crypto algorithm in the handshake process.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/115164852/200841197-f8289e97-483e-4419-b6dc-ce7db669caaa.png)

issue.title: Reverted back SSL_MAX_CERT_LIST_DEFAULT value since large algs are gone
issue.body:
The `SSL_MAX_CERT_LIST_DEFAULT` modification in [ssl.h](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl/blob/master/include/openssl/ssl.h#L4253) is not needed anymore, since Rainbow is not in OQS anymore.

To-do after merge: update the [implementation notes](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl/wiki/Implementation-Notes) wiki page.

comment.body: Ready for review @xvzcf and @baentsch; small code change we don't need anymore.

issue.title: Classify algorithm status
issue.body:
A concrete NIST announcement date, hurray: https://groups.google.com/a/list.nist.gov/g/pqc-forum/c/7yLIZcFOMF0/m/vn43l1tQAQAJ

Bets still accepted.... :-) Eliminating McEliece and SPHINCS+ would be a boon for our CI runtime (and the world's power-consumption-induced CO2 emissions).

comment.body: In light of https://groups.google.com/a/list.nist.gov/g/pqc-forum/c/4MBurXr58Rs/m/WX3u_lU_AQAJ, shall we remove NTRU as well?

issue.title: Re-ran objects.go script after OQS alg changes
issue.body: Re-ran the objects.go script (per the [wiki instructions](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl/wiki/Using-liboqs-algorithms-not-in-the-fork)) after changing the supported OQS algs.

comment.body: @xvzcf, @baentsch, we hadn't run the objects.go script after our last rounds of OQS algs removal; I ran the script and committing the changes.
